com.facebook.buck.rules

Class AbstractBuildRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.rules.AbstractBuildRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasBuildTarget, BuildRule, Comparable<HasBuildTarget>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AaptPackageResources, AbstractNativeBuildRule, AndroidBinary, AndroidBuildConfig, AndroidManifest, AndroidResource, AppleAssetCatalog, AppleResource, BuckExtension, ComputeExopackageDepsAbi, CoreDataModel, DefaultJavaLibrary, DescribedRule, DexProducedFromJavaLibrary, DummyRDotJava, ExportFile, GenAidl, GenParcelable, Genrule, GwtBinary, GwtModule, JavaBinary, Keystore, NdkLibrary, PackageStringAssets, PrebuiltJar, PrebuiltNativeLibrary, PreDexMerge, ProjectConfig, PythonBinary, PythonLibrary, ResourcesFilter, ShBinary, ShTest, UberRDotJava, XcodeNative, XcodeProjectConfig, XcodeWorkspaceConfig

    @Beta
public abstract class AbstractBuildRule
extends Object
implements BuildRule
    Abstract implementation of a BuildRule that can be cached. If its current RuleKey matches the one on disk, then it has no work to do. It should also try to fetch its output from an ArtifactCache to avoid doing any computation.

      • getDeps

        public final ImmutableSortedSet<BuildRule> getDeps()
        Specified by:
        getDeps in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        the set of rules that must be built before this rule. Normally, this matches the value of the deps argument for this build rule in the build file in which it was defined.

        However, there are special cases where other arguments pull in implicit dependencies (e.g., the keystore argument in android_binary). In these cases, the implicit dependencies are also included in the set returned by this method. The value of the original deps argument, as defined in the build file, must be accessed via a custom getter provided by the build rule.

      • appendToRuleKey

        public RuleKey.Builder appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder builder)
        BuildRule.getRuleKey() and BuildRule.getRuleKeyWithoutDeps() uses this when constructing RuleKeys for this class. Every subclass that extends the rule state in a way that matters to idempotency must override appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder) and append its state to the RuleKey.Builder returned by its superclass's appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder) implementation. Example: 
         @Override
 protected RuleKey.Builder appendToRuleKey(RuleKey.Builder builder) {
   return super.appendToRuleKey(builder)
       .set("srcs", srcs),
       .set("resources", resources);
 }

      • appendDetailsToRuleKey

      • getRuleKey

        public RuleKey getRuleKey()
        This method should be overridden only for unit testing.
        Specified by:
        getRuleKey in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        key based on the BuildRule's state, including the transitive closure of its dependencies' keys.

      • getRuleKeyWithoutDeps

        public RuleKey getRuleKeyWithoutDeps()
        Creates a new RuleKey for this BuildRule that does not take getDeps() into account.
        Specified by:
        getRuleKeyWithoutDeps in interface BuildRule
        Returns:
        a non-null RuleKey.
